thread.title: Trump’s Navy Secretary pick withdraws from consideration
thread.title_full: Trump’s Navy Secretary pick withdraws from consideration

author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: Trump’s Navy Secretary pick withdraws from consideration
text:
Trump’s Navy Secretary pick withdraws from consideration Trump’s Navy Secretary pick withdraws from consideration President Trump's Navy Secretary pick, Phillip Bilden, withdrew his name from consideration Sunday. (Pool/Getty Images) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  35 PM 
President Trump's nominee for Navy Secretary has withdrawn his name from consideration, according to a report. 
Philip Bilden, an international financier and former Army Reserve military officer, withdrew his name from consideration Sunday, Defense Secretary Jim Mattis confirmed in a statement, according told Politico. 
"This was a personal decision driven by privacy concerns and significant challenges he faced in separating himself from his business interests," Mattis said. 
A source told Politico that Bilden faced many challenged during a review by the Office of Government Ethics. 
"I informed secretary of Defense Mattis with regret that I respectfully withdraw from consideration as Nominee for the 76th secretary of the Navy," Bilden said in a statement Sunday. Investor Phillip Bilden, managing director of Harbourvest Partners Asia. (Lateline Business / ABC via YouTube) 
White House Press Secretary Spicer denied Bilden was reconsidering the nomination saying in a tweet last Saturday that he was "100 % committed" to the post. 
Bilden's withdrawal comes after billionaire investment banker Vincent Viola, backed out of his Army Secretary nomination earlier this month. 
Viola, who owns the Florida Panthers NHL hockey team, also had trouble stepping away from his financial and business ties. 
The White House hasn't named a replacement pick for Viola.
